result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sylvester E Turner

records.addlTxt:
10:46 AM Defendant Sylvester E Turner not in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Sylvester E Turner.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wolff was just informed that the defendant is currently in Washington County clearing a warrant. Attorney Wolff is waiving time limits and asking for a status date. No objection by the State. The Court will set this matter back for a status of prelim.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

3:13 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Sylvester E Turner not in court. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Court notes that SPD states that Attorney Wolff will be appointed.
Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.
The Court will adjourn.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

4:01 PM Defendant Sylvester E Turner in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS. Defendant states he is eligible for public defender.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:36 AM Defendant Sylvester E Turner not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
The Court will issue a $500.00 arrest warrant.
EXT CODE 2.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
